channel.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India
channel.description: World News: TOI brings the latest world news headlines, Current International breaking news world wide. In depth analysis and top news headlines world wide.

image.title: World News Headlines, Latest International News, World Breaking News - Times of India

item.title: JD Vance backed this startup: 'We had to work in 128-degree heat'
item.description: A JD Vance-backed startup is under the heat as former employees of the company have come out in the open complaining about the appalling working condition. The startup -- AppHarvest -- was an indoor farming hub to grow fruits and vegetables. JD Vance was a board member, an early investor and advocated for the app claiming that it was making a big difference in the world. CNN investigation found out that the working condition was terrible with the temperature reaching triple digit and the workers toiling.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Biden says he would attend Trump inauguration if he wins: 'I have good manners'
item.description: President Joe Biden Tuesday said he would attend Donald Trump's inauguration in January in case the Republican presidential candidate wins this year's election. "I have good manners, not like him," Biden told reporters after being asked if he'd attend. Trump did not attend Biden's inauguration in 2021. It was the first time in over 150 years that the outgoing president skipped the new president's swearing in.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Is Barron Trump handling Donald's social media outreach team?
item.description: After Donald Trump's live stream with YouTuber Adin Ross where the former US president said that his youngest son Barron told him to come on Adin's livestreaming, speculations are rife whether 18-year-old Barron Trump is influencing father's social media game. DailyMail confirmed the speculations and said it's not only Barron but also his influencer friend Bo Loudon whom the president is listening a lot these days.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Pakistan govt accuses ISI ex-chief of political interference
item.description: Pakistan defence minister Khawaja Asif accused retired ISI chief Gen Faiz Hameed of political interference post-retirement, violating the Army Act. Hameed was arrested amidst speculations of his involvement in May 2023 riots linked to former PM Imran Khan. Hameed's tenure had seen controversial actions, including detentions of political rivals and backing the Afghan Taliban's rise.

item.title: Three white police officers win race discrimination claim
item.description: Three white British police officers won a discrimination case after alleging they were overlooked for promotion in favor of a British Punjabi officer due to their race. The tribunal found that Thames Valley Police's decision, aimed at improving diversity, constituted positive discrimination as it bypassed competitive processes, unfairly disadvantaging the claimants.
item.dc:creator: Naomi Canton

item.title: Nate Silver on what's working in favor of Kamala: 'Republicans saying she laughs a lot...'
item.description: Nate Silver, known for his accurate election prediction, updated his forecast and said the Democrats have more than doubled their chance of winning overnight. In an interview with the New York Times, Nate explained his updated forecast and said that it is really going well for Kamala Harris -- she is winning the election at around 52 per cent.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Eliminated 100 militants in Southern Gaza's Rafah, claim Israel army
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Can you imagine Kamala and Xi....: 10 things Trump said in interview with Elon Musk
item.description: Donald Trump's two-hour interview by Elon Musk on Monday night has been touted as the biggest event ahead of the election as it marked Trump's return to X, formerly known as Twitter. Trump was removed from then-Twitter after January 6, 2021 riot and was reinstated after Elon Musk bought it. But he never really came back to Twitter and continued posting on Truth Social.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Yes, Trump 'unknowingly' flew on charter jet previously owned by Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: Donald Trump's campaign on Monday admitted that it was true that the former president used a private plane on Saturday which was once owned by sex-offender Jeffrey Epstein. They said they were not aware that the plane was once owned by Epstein and it was rather an emergency situation as Trump's Boeing 757, Trump Force One, experience a mechanical issue en route to Bozeman.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Why Donald Trump's shoulder pads are all people talking about
item.description: Shoulder pads are garment props used to make one's shoulders broader than they actually are. As former US president Donald Trump gave an interview to Elon Musk on Monday, Donald Trump's shoulder pads are all people taking about. In a viral photo, as Trump is speaking, his shoulder pads can be seen separate failing to cover his drooping frame.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: When Trump said Kamala looked like Melania on Time cover: 'Beautiful...'
item.description: Donald Trump called Kamala Harris beautiful in a bizarre moment that took place in the two-hour-long interview of the former US president taken by Elon Musk. Though Trump tore into Kamala and her administrative, political skills, he said in the picture of her on the Time Magazine, she looked beautiful -- almost like Melania Trump. "She looked very much like our great first lady, Melania. She didn’t look like Camilla (Kamala). Of course, she's a beautiful woman and we'll leave it at that," Trump said. Elon Musk agreed saying, "Right...well yeah".
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'It is rare': Trump campaign office in Virginia burglarised, investigation underway
item.description: Over the weekend, a burglary was reported at a campaign office for Donald Trump in Virginia. The Loudoun County sheriff's office is investigating whether anything was stolen from the Ashburn office, which serves both the Trump campaign and the Virginia 10th district republican committee. Surveillance footage showed a suspect in dark clothing carrying a backpack. The investigation continues.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Royal secrets in the sky: Flight attendant's note reveals Queen Elizabeth II’s personal preferences
item.description: Recently uncovered notes from a British Airways flight attendant revealed Queen Elizabeth II's preferences during a 1989 tour of Singapore and Malaysia, including her fondness for martinis and Velamints. Elizabeth Evans' memorabilia, which also includes items from celebrities aboard the Concorde, will be auctioned soon, offering a glimpse into a bygone era of luxury travel.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Russia steps up assaults on Pokrovsk front in Ukraine's east
item.description: Russian forces increased their attacks on the Pokrovsk front in eastern Ukraine, with the largest number of battles in a day reported in a week, according to the Ukrainian military. Focused around Hrodivka and Zhelanne, the battles represented more than a third of those along the 1,000-kilometer front. The escalation follows Ukraine's cross-border incursion into Russia's Kursk region.

item.title: Meghan Markle felt Prince Harry 'deserved more' materially from the royals: Report
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Vance’s alleged drag photo: Is Trump’s VP pick a doppelgänger for Ivanka?
item.description: An old photo of JD Vance, Trump’s VP pick, in drag has caused a stir online. The Trump-Vance campaign hasn't verified the photo, which is claimed to be from his Yale Law School days. Amid the mixed reactions, Vance’s controversial stance on LGBTQ issues adds to the intrigue surrounding the picture.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: Indians who prepaid $1,000 for Tesla EVs demand refunds: What went wrong?
item.description: In 2016, Elon Musk invited Indians to pre-order the Tesla Model 3, generating excitement. However, many, including tech entrepreneur Vishal Gondal, faced delays and have yet to receive their cars. Market challenges, high import duties, and competition from local brands have complicated Tesla's entry into India. The EV market in India remains small, with Tata Motors leading in sales.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: US elections: Harris cautiously outlines 2024 agenda - 'Building consensus' for democratic victory
item.description: Kamala Harris positioned herself for the 2024 election by addressing past policy weaknesses and outlining her governance vision. Following Biden's decision not to run, she updated her policy stances, focusing on the economy. Her notable proposal to end federal taxation of tipped earnings aligns with Trump’s plan. Harris emphasized bipartisan achievements during the Biden-Harris administration.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: 'My rights were violated’: Texas women accuse hospitals of denying care for life-threatening pregnancies
item.description: Two Texas women filed federal complaints against hospitals for denying care during their life-threatening ectopic pregnancies, claiming severe injuries. The law firm representing them, the Center for Reproductive Rights, cited confusion following Roe v. Wade's overturn as the cause. Hospitals face investigation by the US Department of Health and Human Services.
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk

item.title: ‘I am a lesbian’: TikToker banned for life by American Airlines over alleged ‘sex with man’ on flight
item.dc:creator: TOI World Desk
